MARK.raw_line: Largeman, what the hell are you doin' here?Puck. Sorry.Same.Where the fuck you been, man? You're like still acting and shit, right?That's cool. I hear that place is pretty tucked up, man. I got a cousin who's a writer out there. He says that place is mad crazy. Coke everywhere, parties, horny-ass bitches...What?Terry.No bitch, he's in LA now. He's a writer. He's writin' a movie about snowboarders or some shit, X don't know. I should introduce you to him Largeman, maybe you guys could do something together.Supposedly.Yeah, he lives up on the hill. We're probably gonna head over there right after we bury your mom.Same.All right. Well, welcome back.holy chit look at this guy! Everyone looks to Large at the end of the line.Get the fuck up here, bitch! This guy does not wait for a beer! This is a movie star! This is Jersey's DeNiro and shit. Mark sloppily hugs Large. Others slap him five as Large awkwardly navigates between variations of hugs and handshakes.Press junket.You like that? That's improvisation, bitch. You can use it.You see this?That was him. Dug the hole myself.Nah. Ugly motherfucker though, huh? It pains Large to even try to respond to that.You want to see the most fucked up thing? They arrive at the landing outside a door with a "New Jersey Devils" poster on it.This is the tucked up thing. Be swings the door to the bedroom open revealing the dark bedroom of your average teenage boy. A teenage couple drunkenly makes out on the bed. The mattress has no sheets.Check that out. Mark points to a hole in the ceiling where a ceiling fan has been ripped out. Wires dangle. The fan lies next to the bed.Shut the fuck up. Who is that, O'Malley? I'll beat your aaelI can't tell what's more disgusting; those two hooking up in that room, or those two hooking up.Here, bro. He passes Large the golf book.Really? But you're like a movie star and shit.Okay, how 'bout this. He holds up a bottle of Tequila with a ribbon around !.to neck.He got the shit kicked out of him.How do you know? He got the shit kicked out of him by Tyrell Freedmen.He knocked your teeth out.Air bloody tooth.What the fuck is Klingon?Don't be shy, Tim.You've got to be kidding me.You must have gotten it confused with "Pleej artulyah. Hagtooth pleep." Theylaugh.You know what that means, Tim?well I do. It means get the fuck out of my house before I chop your fuckin' head off. Silence. Large stares at Mark in disbelief, then starts to LAUGH. They all start to join him except Mark. They stop laughing.He's just a fast-food knight.My Mom did it.Don't bring those fucking people here anymore, Mom. Or I'm leaving. I'm serious. No Medieval Times people in this house. He passes the bong to his Mom. She smokes it, then sits down, forcing them both to slide over. Several cats surround her_I'm declaring it. Now. It's declared, now. Thank you. No more.No, Ma. I'm not doin' the stupid tapes.Mom, shut-up about those fucking tapes. It's a scam.In China.It's bullshit. You were just all baked,out and you thought it would be a good idea.I do apply myself, Mom; everyday, I work my ass off burying dead people, okay? I'm only twenty-six, I'm not in any rush. What's your rush for? Just let me be, all right? I don't rush you.Fine. Do'em.She drives me crazy. She's gets all fried out and makes me feel like I gotta impress her all the fucking time. And you know what? I'm okay with being unimpressive; I sleep better. Large site forward abruptly.How could you leave all that Lithium? I was totally gonna hit you up for some.Vagina!Hey. Nice to meet you.I'm sorry I yelled- 'vagina' just now, I didn't see you.Nice. Let's get fucked up. Off Large's smile we:One, two, three! Everyone jumps into the pool SCREAMING except for Large. He stands there staring at the water.You look like a drunken beaver. They all laugh- Sam swims over to him sitting on the steps. She smiles at him.How 'bout some fucking furniture dude.Silent Velcro. Lucky motherfucker. I got an idea: loud tape, we'll make millions.You're the one who said they sent you away.I'm dangerous and I didn't get to go to boarding school.You're gay.For her funeral.Please don't remind me.Fuck you.Don't you fail if it breaks?Jesse cooked his. They both laugh.'Cause my wife was Tanisha Lubin.He's a boy. His name's Shantel.They're shorts.Yeah, he's a boy, Shantel. They're shorts.Fuck yeah, dude. Those are collectors items. Do you have any idea how much those things will be worth some day.Hell yeah. That shit's like an investment. I have lots of little investments - all over the place. I'm gonna sel3. 'em all one day and just live off 'em.Which?I don't know. Mint; maybe two, three.Yeah. But it's too early. You don't sell'em yet. Don't you know anything about investing. I'm gonna live off that shit. That "Schwarzkopf" card is worth at least five something. And if you have the complete set it's worth like thousands.Almost. The corners are bent on my "Friendly Fire" and someone stole my "Wolf Blitzer".One of my Mom's Medieval Times friends, man. Drug addicts.Yeah.It doesn't matter if you're a rich house wife looking for your muscle relaxers or some crack head drying cars: people will do anything in this town to get their drug money. Now look, what do you gotta do today? I gotta little going away present for you. But I kinds gotta track it down. So, can you give me a ride?What?Say it... speak.She can come, I don't care.We're making some money for your present. Just don't look so guilty.Oh, no. Benson.Don't give him your number. Karl approaches.Just that Gleason kid. Oh, and Tina.You remember Tina. She was like anorexic. She did gymnastics... Sam is horrified by this conversation.I don't know. She wasn't Jewish, I didn't bury her.Listen I'm gonna go grab that thing. So just hang here and I'll be back.Hey. We gotta get going.Why is it always the losers who get into the pyramid schemes? Why isn't it ever some charming hot girl nagging you incessantly to buy shit?Detergent or some shit. The thing I don't understand is, if it worked, why would he be working here. The guy's a freak; he pops Darvocet like it's Ritalin.I'd like to return these.Actually, no. It was a gift. She clicks her tongue. She begins filling out a form.They're not sharp enough.No. Not for what we need them for. They couldn't cut cans.No, but in the commercial they say that if I wanted to cut cans I could. But with these knives I can't.Yeah, they're just... I don't want them; not sharp enough. She rings it into the register and counts out bills to Mark.A major loop-hole in the Handi- World return policy permits returns without receipts on items below forty dollars.I hit every employee once, then wait for them to. hire. new ones. Luckily, no one works at Handi- World for very long. Except Karl Benson.I don't need your money, I'm making my own right now.i don't take anybody's money, Andrew. I make my own. Favors are bad news. And the only thing worse than a favor, is a favor involving money.This will only take a second.Got it, let's go.I've got that Nitrous tank for you, so can I get that info?Dude we're kind of in a rush.Wow.He's the guy who needs that thing. Look I brought you the tank, so can you just tell us where to go now?we're in a hurry.Blow? Please. If I was gonna give you coke we'd have gone to the high school football practice and we'd a been reeling five hours ago.Wow. That's the most worked up I've ever seen you.I'm gonna kill that motherfucker.You're dead. They play wrestle as Sam watches.I've heard about it. They were supposed to build a mall here I think.They love their mall's here man. Okay let's just find this guy and get outta here.It's a surprise, you'll see. Mark walks on ahead of them down a path that winds down alongside the abyss.I guess this is it.Yeah. Are you Albert?What do you mean, this is nice.It's hardly the bottom, dude. Did you see that cliff? Albert returns with FAYE, an equally gentle and caring looking woman in her early thirties.Never crossed my mind.That's it. Thank you. They all stand.I know. Don't you wanna know what's in the bag?I'd be lying to ya if I told ya this was my plan all along.Hey, if you ever need a Kato, you know where to find me. Large sits back down on the bike into Sam's wet arms. He stares at the pendant in his hand.

GIDEON.raw_line: "Well besides that tire. Lincoln, how was the show?"Mmnn.She's on call tonight; she volunteers as an EMT for the Rescue Squad. She's doing so well in med school.I have very fond memories of the two of you running around here when you were little kids like brother and sister. Silence.So how are you?Go see Dr. Cohen first thing tomorrow morning. Re's a neurologist in my building. I'll call him and he'll fit you in. I'm sure it's nothing to worry about. Silence. Large nods.Oh? That's nice. We've been... doing a lot of work on it.Yeah. That's new. Did you eat? You should eat. Aunt Sylvia put this whole thing together out there. I think there's enough food out there for... everybody. I mean, more.than everybody... there's a lot of food out there.There's dessert too.Cake or something.I'm glad you're here. Large stops in the doorway.Hi. Large jumps around and puts his hand to his chest.Just wake up?Sleep all right?Mmmm.Janice will make you some lunch.Well I guess it's breakfast for you. What time is it?No I can. I know. I figured you would want to...I knew that you would. Silence.Occasionally she would hum.., your Mother. Always the same tune and I never knew what the song was. I don't even know if it was a song or if she just made it up - It's funny because it always struck me as so out of character for her and every time she did it... I just always liked it. But I never told her I could hear her because I knew if I ever did she would stop.No. I didn't hear anything. The TV was on pretty loud. I always watch the weather report before I go to sleep.What?I would have too, but no. Nothing. What?What ?What? No.Its not that.No. Because they know she drowned, Andrew.No.No. Yee!I know! Do you think I don't know?!Shut-up! .lust shut your fucking mouth. Large is taken aback.You want to make her crazy. Why? Does that make it easier for you? Tears stream down Gideon's face, He sits down on the toilet and cries.It's like you want to torture yourself or something! Why would you want to think that? That that happened. Why would you ever want to think that? Large moves closer to his father who SOBS with his head in his lap and his arms over his head. It takes everything Large has to reach out his hand and almost touch his father's shoulder, but he doesn't make it and his hand lands on the sink next to him.I just want everyone to be happy again.I haven't seen you in awhile.Dr. Cohen called. There's nothing wrong with you.when are you thinking of leaving?We need to talk.what are you doing... now?okay. And well talk. we owe that to each other.We owe it to her.Good.Oh, hey, hey c'mon in. He finds his glasses on his chest and lifts the remote to turn off the TV.No, no, it's uh... I was just reading.You've been avoiding me.I'm sure you can find plenty of things in your life to be angry about, but what I don't understand is why you're so angry at me. All I ever wanted was for everybody to be happy again, Andrew. That's all I ever wanted.Well we might have a shot at it if you could just forgive yourself for what you did.Going against your doctor's recommendation; that's a pretty weighty experiment to take on don't you think?Perhaps the great tragedy of my life, will be that you both deserved more than I knew how to give?I need an ambulance.

JESSE.raw_line: bargeman. They hug and pat each other on the back.Yeah. You gotta come by my new place.Sorry... you know... I heard.That's fucked up.Basically, "The Man bought my silent Velcro patent.Well you knew I was an inventor right?Oh well yeah... I wasn't really an inventor yet. Anyway I developed this little item that's just like Velcro but doesn't make that annoying Velcro noise.A lot.Nothing. They laugh.Seriously. Absolutely nothing. I've never been so bored in all my life. The first month I bought a whole bunch of shit, but then that got boring. But I... nothing.I'm not really motivated to do much at all. It's kind of funny, I guess I had kind of planned on my whole life being about struggling to get money. But now that I've got more than I ever dreamed, I'm really not sure what to do with myself. I stare at walls a lot.Well then here. Eat this. Jesse opens his palm to reveal a tiny hit of E with a SMILEY FACE on it.Welcome home.They're all legal. I think. He smiles a toothy grin. KELLY, a young hot girl with a raspy voice takes control.The girl has a point.Largeman, this is Dana. Large looks over to the sexy young girl whom he locked eyes with before. She smiles at him. Awkwardness fills the room.This is gonna be a good night. Everything SPEEDS-UP and SLOWS DOWN. A barrage of images: people hooking up, girls kissing girls, guys feeling girls up, joints being passed, one girl crying, Mark showing off his golf swing, Large trying to take deep breaths, Jesse and Dave hugging, two-figures moving quickly under a blanket. Kenny in full riot gear letting people take turns hitting him in his helmet. FASTER : hands gripping each other, a nose on a neck, hands gripping a waist. Ecu s Largos face as his eyes swim in their eocketo s end the corners of his mouth lift with the idea of a smile..'Kay ready? He unleashes the arrow into the air and the three of them scramble around in terror trying to avoid wherever it will land. It plunges into the earth three feet from Sam's foot. Frozen, she yanks on her ear; hard.This fuckin' guy. I'm glad you're back, man, because this town is so messed up. Everyone's got there drug of choice like in "Brave New World". Did you ever read that book? Who wrote that? Aldous something. Aldous-.and people are just like that here, man. Huxtable3 Aldous Huxtable. That's it.Hey.Dude maybe you should stay on the steps; I don't know CPR.I bought a chair but I didn't like it.Its keeping us warm.Whoa, listen to this girl.You're like a little detective.To be honest, I never really knew either. I mean I heard stories.But your Mom was in the wheelchair long before you left.All he heard of that whole story was "left drugs in LA".Crackhead. A 19 year old girl from the pool comes around the corner

SAM.raw_line: I recognize you.No, not from high school, from TV. Didn't you play the retarded quarterback.Are you really retarded? He stares at her.That's cool. Great job, man. You were- I mean I thought you were really retarded. You were just as good as that corky kid and he's really retarded. I mean if there's some kind of like retarded Emmy you could win. You'd kick Corky's ass.Oh, okay. Right on. My cousin's an actor. Jake Ryan Winters. I doubt you'd know him. He was on "Sheena" once as some gnome or something. I think that's great though.Oh that last scene where you make that speech to the whole stadium and your Dad gives you the thumbs up; that was - it was emotional. I mean I didn't cry, but I think my Dad did.So are you doing anything else?Any other retarded roles? I'm sure you could definitely get more of those.I can't believe you're not really retarded. Jake's not a very good actor. I mean on "Sheens" you couldn't really tell 'cause he was in a hairy gnome suit, but he used to put on these really low-budge renditions of Andrew Lloyd Webber musicals in our attic when we were kids and they were awful. It sucks 'cause there isn't a whole lotta work for little people, you know? Anyway sorry I talk too much, fill out your forms. Large just stares at her. She's funny."The Shins." You know them?Oh are you kidding me? You gotta here this one song, it'll change your life I promise you. Oh but you have to fill out your forms. Conundrum.So what are you doing here?Waiting for a friend. You?Fuck, that was nosey, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to be nosey. That was so nosey.Cool.You didn't. I'm Sam.Charging. I'm a robot.People call me lots of things.I could say "no", but how will you know I'm not lying.You can do that?Who's bike is this?This is the point where you ask me if I'd like a ride home?Yup.Fine, but I ' m not getting in that sidecar,Sidecars are for bitches. Anyone who gets in that thing is automatically your bitch. Thus, I will ride on the back. She climbs on the back behind him.I thought my boyfriend was gonna pick me up on his bike, so I brought it... But then he couldn't so...No, its a Ninja. Way faster than this thing.You can use it on a motorcycle. Anyway, how's your head?Cool. Make a right here. They stop at a light.Can you elaborate on "doing anything"?Wow. well that's pretty damn random of ya, Andrew.'Nice to meet you. May I use you?' That's the Hollywood in ya I guess.Can we have code names too?okay. But don't try and like kidnap me or anything, because my step-uncle's a bounty hunter and I could have you tracked and killed.No, I don't have a boyfriend.okay so sometimes I lie. I'm weird, man. About random stuff too; and I don't even know why I do it. It's like a tick. I swear, sometimes I hear myself say something and then I think: "Wow, that's not even remotely true.Well, I always feel bad and admit them when they're lies.Down, Kevin! Mom! Kick their balls! Kick their balls! Anthrax, heel! Mom! Sam tries slapping them on their backs. OLIVIA, Sam's mother, comes rushing in clutching a hamster with a bloody nose.Mom, this is .Andrew...He's the retarded quarterback.Come on in. They walk into the LIVING ROOM.So this is it.No it's not. You don't have to say that just 'cause you can't think of anything else to say.Yeah, well we never got around to taking it down, so when it got to be fall again we just figured we might as well leave it. Are you freaked out? You're totally freaked out aren't you?Wanna see my room?Titembay, this is my friend, Andrew. Andrew this is my brother, Titembay.Oh, its okay.Thanks.This is it. She puts on a CD, .Nothing fancy, but...Yeah, it's weird, huh? You're so freaked out right now, you're like running for the door. You can go, don't feel bad.What?Yeah.Yeah, he's my brother.Well kind of. My mom adopted him years ago from Sally Strothers. one of those: For the cost of a cup of coffee a day" kind of things. where she's like, "How can you sit there and not help the children?" And we just couldn't. We couldn't sit there and not help those children. So we sent him letters and pictures for years and then I got really into ice skating and we kind of forgot about'em. Then one day the phone rang and it was Titembay and he was at the dry cleaners around the corner and he said that he was going to school at Rutgers and living in the dorms, but since he was used to living with his tribe he'd much rather live with his family.Yeah and he's been here ever since. He's an amazing guy, you gotta hear some of his stories. I mean this guy struggled through so much because he wanted to learn. I think of what he's accomplished and I just feel so lazy. He's studying criminal justice at Rutgers right now and when he was a baby he was one of those kids with flies all over his face.That, my friend, is a true story. I'm not that good- A pause. Sam sits on the bed. THE AWESOKE MUSIC PLAYS. She breaks the moment by pulling a small tattered piece of satin fabric off the bed.This is Tickle. Large sits down next to her.Tickle is my favorite thing in the whole world. It's all that's left of Nannie... my blanket.Yeah.What?Wow, so you're like really Jewish? Large laughs.Yeah, you are aren't you?I don't really believe in God.Oh, I believe in Tickle_ They laugh. A nice moment. They hold eye contact. THE AWESOMEWe're not gonna like make out or anything.I'm sorry, I just totally ruined the moment didn't I?I just mean we're not gonna like make out.I didn't mean to put that out there, that was lame. BLAAAAHRH. That was so dumb. You know what I do when I'm feeling completely unoriginal? She stands up and does really weird gestures with her hands.Not in this spot, no. You just witnessed a completely original moment in history. It's refreshing. You try one.Come on.Come on. What are you shy? This is your chance to do something that has never, ever been done before and will never be copied throughout human existence. If nothing else, you'll be remembered as the only person who ever did this. He stares at her. She's not gonna let up. Large lifts his index finger in the air and twirlsa it.Oh, I've done that one before. She bursts out laughing. He smiles. SAM So I got to bury this hamster before the dogs eat him. You warms help?Yeah.I know. They stand in silence.It's not that we're bad pet owners or anything, it's just that we've had so many of them over the years.What are you thinking about?Yes.No. A second ago before I asked.What, dates?Oh. Who else died?How did she die? Large thinks about that.When?Oh my God. Tears roll down her face.I don't know, I'm sorry, I'm not usually like this. It's just so sad. It's so tragic. Isn't it? It is. It's like real life tragedy or something.What should we do?We usually say something.its not funny. Jelly you were a great pet. Tears roll down her face.I'm so, so sorry I forgot to take the wheel out of the cage. I'm so sorry about that.Mom, no.No, I couldn't have.Mom. I'm asking you seriously.Were. They cross to the TV room where they find Titembay wearing rubber gloves, seated next to an open tool box, dusting the coffee table for fingerprints and referring to an open text book. White powder reveals fingerprints everywhere, including the TV screen.I can't believe you're showing him this.Okay this was great, but we have to go now.Mom.I love you too. Olivia kisses Sam on her forehead.Mom.Okay, good-night. Night, Tim.Oh c'mon. Don't ya see that it's a joke. If you can't laugh at yourself life's gonna seem a lot longer than you'd like.I lied again. I have epilepsy.I had a seizure in the law office where I work and they said their insurance would only cover me if I wore "preventative covering".The helmet I was carrying. Large is silent.Oh come on, that's funny. I'm the only person in the world wearing a helmet to work who isn't putting out fires or racing for NASCAR. But what do you do? I can't quit; their insurance is amazing. What can you do? You laugh. I'm not saying I don't cry a lot, but in between I laugh and realize how silly taking anything very seriously is. And plus, I look forward to a good cry. I just love the way it feels.What do you mean?It's okay.Hey! what are you doing?Can you swim?Fooled me. I thought you just had a cramp.I can't whistle if it makes you feel any better.There's a handful of normal kid things I kinda wish I'd missed. She floats on her back beside him.So how long are you gonna stay here?No, I mean in Jersey.I still feel at home in my house.Maybe.Where is it?So why did they send you away? She takes a sip of her beer.Why did they send you to boarding school? Large looks to Jesse and Mark.But obviously something happened. I mean there must have been an event.Am I being too nosey?Yeah.Shut up.Why?You couldn't make her happy.Oh my God.Until now.It sounds like a punishment.You're "in it" right now aren't you?My Mom always says that when she can see I'm like working something big out she'll say, "Are you in it right now?" And I look at you, and you tell me this story and... you're... you're definitely "in it" right now.Maybe that's why you've been getting those headaches.Good stuff?I got a little buzz. That's what I've got. What do you got?Who's that?Hey.Nice meeting you.Hi.You delivered him?Wow.Nice to meet you.How do you know she's a hooker?Julia Roberts married Lyle Lovett.I'm not innocent.He was protecting me.He likes me.You're my knight in shining armor.Wow.Yeah I remember reading about it in the paper.I must say, I've been continually impressed today with how each new place you bring us manages to be weirder and weirder.I'd love some tea. Large and Mark look at her.Wow. So how deep does it go?It's kind of an odd job isn't it? Guardian of an infinite abyss?No.Save something from being discovered.Well thank you for the tea.What is it?Why not? I'm curious. She's sitting here, across from you and you can say anything at all. All the things you never got a chance to say.What?Oh, my God, Large I think I see one.Yeah, I do. Don't move, we should save it or something. She finds a clear plastic cup.Here don't move, I'm gonna get it. She tries to coerce the- tear off his cheek into the cup, like a child capturing an inch worm.Is that it?Well if you do, let me know and I'll grab the cup, okay?This was a good idea. Keep talking.oh, Large I'm never gonna be able to get all these. They laugh. She moves closer, wrapping her legs around his waist to hug him close. She kisses his-'wet cheeks.I'm never gonna be able to get all these, am I?To be your Mom.Look at me.Let go. Listen to me. Just don't hang onto any of it anymore. You're holding on so tight and you just... you don't have to hang onto any of it anymore. Just let it all go.Just let it all go. He cries with his elbow over his eyes.What do you feel? Describe it. That always helps me. My mom always says, "What's the word that's burning in your chest..." She touches his chest with her hand.What is it? He looks away. Soared.Look at me. He does.Yeah, it is.I know. But that... that is life. if nothing else... That is life. St's real. And sometimes it burns. But maybe... it might be all there is.Tissue? They both laugh; a release.Trying to barrel through.Well it sounds like you were due to fall.How do you feel? On Large's face as he thinks about that question.What are you doing?No. Why? How can you... how could you... What's going on? What happened? We can figure out the long distance thing. Don't... this is a good thing, Large. Don't... you're gonna be... please don't do this. Shestarts crying.No.What are you doing?The ellipses?Yeah.
